text: my first visit to the Philippines was in
January 2014 it didn't take long for me
to fall in love with this country for
years and 27 visits later I can
confidently tell you that the
Philippines is my favorite country in
the world not only do they have the
friendliest people but everyone can
speak fluent English and the untouched
nature and world-class beaches are
second to none have I mentioned cheap
prices too when planning a trip here it
can be daunting to decide where to go
since there are more than 7,000 islands
scattered around the South Pacific Ocean
so in this video I'm gonna share with
you my seven favourite island in the
Philippines in order with number one
being the best one Sikhi horde the most
beautiful island I've ever seen and
still not overrun by tourists yet the
only way to get to cqr is by to our
ferry from Zuma get to but hurry up
because an airport is opening up there
soon and it's bound to turn into another
Boracay to share go this teardrop-shaped
island off the southeastern coast of the
Philippines will not disappoint it's
nothing short of spectacular share Gow
is known to have the best wave for
surfing and the relaxing atmosphere is
just the icing on the cake 3 Palau on
the longer narrow island in southwestern
Philippines home to el nido and korone
is famous for its limestone cliffs
sunken ship from World War 2 and
crystal-clear seawater if you scuba dive
then head to barracuda lake a hot water
lake made from volcanoes or go kayaking
through the mysterious underground river
we're about to enter the underground
river for Boracay the party island of
the Philippines and the place where I've
spent the last 4 days with my family
along the beach set boardwalk you can
find lounge after bar after Club with
music drinking and dancing all night
long when you're feeling hungover
don't forget two days off on the amazing
white sandy beaches five bahala home of
the Chocolate Hills where 1776 mystical
mountains are scattered around a 20-mile
radius we are here at the famous
chocolate hills of all the hills are
mostly covered in green grass but they
turn brown like chocolate during the dry
season hence the name Chocolate Hills
you cannot miss out on behold six
because while vehicle is more of a
region than one island it's a fantastic
place in the Philippines that I highly
suggest visiting go and see the
perfectly cone-shaped my own volcano or
take the short journey to Kailash Island
and camp out on the beach seven Luzon
last but not least is Lu's own the
biggest and most populated island in the
Philippines were Manila lies the island
is covered in beautiful mountains
beaches palm trees and Spanish colonial
landmark my favorite places on Luzon
Island are Batangas bata on and of
course Manila which has many great
places if you know where to go there are
still several islands I haven't visited
yet that are high on my bucket list such
as Madonna Kalin Gama and Rob lung but
that's what next year is for what's your
favorite item here please share in the
comments below so everyone can discover

Philippines
